meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something with force.
meanings.sent1: She squishes the playdough in her hands.
meanings.sent2: He squishes the bug with his shoe.
meanings.sent3: The cat squishes the toy mouse in its paws.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rock squishes the delicate flower beneath it.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler squishes his opponent to the ground with a powerful move.

meanings.definition: To make a soft, wet sound when pressed or stepped on.
meanings.sent1: The mud squishes under her boots as she walks.
meanings.sent2: The sponge squishes when you squeeze it.
meanings.sent3: The wet sand squishes between his toes at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The ripe tomato squishes in your hand when you press it.
meanings.sent5: The soaked sponge squishes out water when you squeeze it.
